channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Christian Davenport, Rocket Dreams - Musk, Bezos, and the Inside Story of the New, Trillion-Dollar Space Race
channel.desc: The Washington Post's Christian Davenport reports on the private companies in space flight and the rivalry between Elon Musk's SpaceX and Jeff Bezos' Blue Origin. Politics and Prose in Washington, D.C., hosts this event.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: David Shambaugh, Breaking the Engagement
channel.desc: George Washington University professor David Shambaugh discusses the evolution and disintegration of America's relationship with China since 1972.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Q & A
channel.desc: Forbes technology reporter Emily Baker-White, author of Every Screen on the Planet, talks about the rise of TikTok, used by an estimated 150 million Americans; she discusses the U.S. government's concerns over its influence and ownership.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Phyllis Bennis, Understanding Palestine and Israel
channel.desc: Institute for Policy Studies fellow Phyllis Bennis discusses the history of the Israel-Palestine conflict since 1948.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Yaakov Katz, While Israel Slept
channel.desc: Former Jerusalem Post editor-in-chief Yaakov Katz discusses why Hamas' surprise attack on Israel on Oct. 7, 2023, was successful.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Douglas Murray, On Democracies and Death Cults
channel.desc: British author and journalist Douglas Murray argues that protecting Israel is fundamental to preserving Western civilization. He says that both are under attack by Hamas and extremists who share their ideology.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: America 250
channel.desc: Stacy Schiff talks about the life and legacy of American Revolution leader Samuel Adams.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: America 250
channel.desc: Books That Shaped America explores Common Sense, a 1776 pamphlet authored by Thomas Paine which urged the American colonies to declare independence from Great Britain.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: America 250
channel.desc: T.H. Breen, American law and governance professor at the Library of Congress, looks at how small towns and cities operated under a system of shared sacrifice and democratic ideals during the American Revolution.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Matt Richtel, How We Grow Up - Understanding Adolescence
channel.desc: Matt Richtel looks at the changes in the brain during puberty and how the experience of adolescence has shifted over time; Tattered Cover Books in Denver hosts this event.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Clare Morell, The Tech Exit
channel.desc: Ethics and Public Policy Center fellow Clare Morell shares her views on how to protect children from the harms of smart phones and other digital technologies.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Christian Davenport, Rocket Dreams - Musk, Bezos, and the Inside Story of the New, Trillion-Dollar Space Race
channel.desc: The Washington Post's Christian Davenport reports on the private companies in space flight and the rivalry between Elon Musk's SpaceX and Jeff Bezos' Blue Origin. Politics and Prose in Washington, D.C., hosts this event.

channel.title: Public Affairs Events
channel.desc: Public affairs events, congressional hearings, speeches, and interviews.

channel.title: Live: U.S. Senate
channel.desc: Gavel-to-gavel and uninterrupted live coverage of the U.S. Senate from the Capitol Building in Washington, D.C.
